comments:
When using the web service wizard on a project which is located outside standard eclipse workspace (here in "D:\Projets"), the following error appears. Such error did not exist with previous versions of WebTools (M9) and did not appears if the projet is located at the standard workspace directory.

The configuration is Web tool 1.0 RC4 with 3.1.1 SDK.

Kathy, just a wild guess, but this may be related to the changes to have the Axis emitters write to a staging area.

(In reply to comment #0)
sorry for my previsious speedy enter...
...but the same problem can be found in the WTP 1.0RC5.
IMO this is a big stop if there are no workaround.

(In reply to comment #0)

> When using the web service wizard on a project which is located outside
> standard eclipse workspace (here in "D:\Projets"), the following error appears.
> Such error did not exist with previous versions of WebTools (M9) and did not
> appears if the projet is located at the standard workspace directory.

I have also researched this bug, as it bit me as well, but I didn't spot the thing about the project being outside the workspace dir. 

The problem starts in org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.consumption.core.command.WSDL2JavaCommand in the method moveGeneratedWSDL(), which copies from the generated path to the target path, which is found like this (line 190-191):

     IPath targetPath = FileResourceUtils
		.getWorkspaceRootRelativePath(new Path(outputWsdlLocation));

This is the error, since for projects that are placed outside the workspace directory, getWorkspaceRootRelativePath returns the path unchanged, and thus makeFolderPaths gets called using an absolute path which is file-system absolute instead of workspace-relative.

Instead, why not find the project relative root and change makeFolderPath to ensure that this gets created instead? 

+1 on the severity of the bug.

Created an attachment (id=32354)
Patch for fixing WSDL2Java process for projects outside the workspace

This is a simple fix for the bug where the file operation don't account for the case where the project is placed outside the workspace but only for three cases found in the Axis WS support:

1. The original one in (WSDL2JavaCommand) where WSDD files are copied from the temp generation folder to an "absolute path" which is in fact a location, since FileResourceUtils#getWorkspaceRootRelativePath() couldn't do its job.

2. In the same method where Java files are copied, exactly the same problem, but with the twist that the Java file location actually is generated all the way out in the UI (in SkeletonConfigWidgetDefaultingCommand).

3. Java2WSDLCommand also had similar bug, since it relied on FileResourceUtils#getWorkspaceRootRelativePath(). I haven't tested this. It hasn't been tested extensively, and perhaps only points to a few of the problems.

In theory, this fix "SHOULD" work with linked source folders, but it wasn't tested. It will probably give strangeness if there's aliasing between projects/linked folders, but that's a no-no anyway.

Other instances of this mistake are probably lurking out there. Some of this stuff can probably be refactored to something a lot nicer, I'd think.

I haven't performance tested this, but I think it may be faster since it checks for existing directories only up to where it adds, not all the way from the workspace root (fewer file ops).

Plugin org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.consumption.core:
* org\eclipse\jst\ws\internal\axis\consumption\core\command\WSDL2JavaCommand.java
* org\eclipse\jst\ws\internal\axis\consumption\core\command\Java2WSDLCommand.java

Plugin: org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.creation.ui
* org\eclipse\jst\ws\internal\axis\creation\ui\widgets\skeleton\SkeletonConfigWidgetDefaultingCommand.java
Now uses proper generation of the Java folder's file location as a URL.

Pligin: org.eclipse.wst.command.env:
* org\eclipse\wst\command\internal\env\common\FileResourceUtils.java
(dangerous getWorkspaceRootRelativePath removed and "location" version of makeFolderPath and makeFile were created)

Hope this helps, it works for me now! Sorry 'bout the format of the patch file, I didn't have time to setup CVS.

Jesper, thank you for your patch!

Here's the CVS patch for fixing the problem with projects outside the workspace.  I've tested in in bottom-up, top-down and client scenarios for projects both in and outside of the workspace.

I'll also include the JARs for the affected plugins so that users affected by this problem can workaround the problem in WTP 1.0.  This fix will be available in the WTP 1.0.1 maintenance driver the week of 01/09.

Created an attachment (id=32599)
CVS code patch for axis.consumption.core

Created an attachment (id=32600)
CVS code patch for axis.,creation.ui

Created an attachment (id=32601)
CVS code patch for wst.command.env

Created an attachment (id=32603)
JAR for axis.consumption.core

Created an attachment (id=32604)
JAR for axis.creation.ui

Created an attachment (id=32605)
JAR for wst.command.env
Patch committed and released as v20060106_1232.

Fixes is contained in WTP 1.0.1 M build M200601102004:

http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/M-M200601102004-200601102004/

I tested on the last build M200602141429-200602141429 and everything is OK.
Thanks Kathy!

Originator had verified on M200602141429-200602141429.  I've also re-verify on the 0217_1228 WTP 1.0.1 candidate build.

Closing defect.
